results.title: Aeradio: the pilot's link to the ground
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Department of the Interior and John Martin-Jones
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of the Communications Officers - the men who keep a constant radio check on all aircraft in the air, maintaining voice or morse contact with the pilots, supplying information on weather conditions ahead, giving position, and acting, generally, as the pilot’s agent on the ground.

results.title: Adventuring pups
results.creator_credit: Young America Films and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: A film designed to stimulate observation in the young child, by introducing three puppies, and following their adventures on a farm and in the woods.

results.title: Adventures of two little goats
results.brief_description: Designed for use in primary classes, this film illustrates the habits and characteristics of goats, and shows typical scenes of farm life. Tells of the adventures of twin goats when they set out to explore a large pasture for the first time.

results.title: Adventures of Bunny Rabbit (K)
results.brief_description: Story of a mother rabbit and her very hungry son, Bunny Rabbit, who goes in search of fresh lettuce on a nearby farm. After several encounters with other animals and two narrow escapes from a hungry fox and an angry farmer, Bunny hurries home, much wiser about the ways of the outside world. Designed to teach younger children the features and habits of rabbits and other woodland and farm animals. No other credits available.

results.title: Adventures of a young eagle
results.creator_credit: Hungarofilm, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Istvan Nagy
results.brief_description: The adventures of three young eagles living at the very top of a tree. One is frightened out of the nest while the parent birds are away. His survival illustrates that “learning” is an exciting part of the adventures of a young eagle. Designed to stimulate children to observe things around them, and stimulate creative expression.

results.title: Adventures of a chipmunk family
results.brief_description: The growth and activities of chipmunk babies in their own home from early spring to the beginning of winter. The babies at the age of three weeks; two weeks later they leave through the tunnel to explore the outside world; how the mother chipmunk cares for her babies; how chipmunks work together to dig new tunnels and add rooms to their den; how they gather and store nuts to last the winter.

results.title: Adventure playground: London
results.brief_description: Filmed in one of the Greater London Council’s adventure playgrounds where activities are built around tall forest trees. It shows the playground activities which appeal to children and in which they can engage with comparative safety and security in the presence of a play leader. All types of play equipment are obviously enjoyed by the children of all ages in the delightful park setting. A non-narrated films blending music and playground noises in its soundtrack.

results.title: Adventure on
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Sumner, British Information Services, Film Producers Guild and Tom Stobart

results.title: Adventure in Venice
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: Presents aspects of day-to-day life in Venice. Tells a story about a boy who loses a prized model ship on the waterways of his city. Gives a comprehensive view of this water dependent city, noting the historic sites and large tourist trade.
results.description: Presents aspects of day-to-day life in Venice. Tells a story about a boy who loses a prized model ship on the waterways of his city. Gives a comprehensive view of this water dependent city, noting the historic sites and large tourist trade.
